Bcl2 and BclxL, as anti-apoptotic proteins, are known to be overexpressed in diverse tumours causing cancer cell survival and drug resistance
14 . Inhibition of these proteins expression resulted in cancer cell death and has been exploited as a strategy for anticancer drug discovery
15â€“16 . Treatment of SW-620 with compound 7c resulted in a dose-dependent inhibition of Bcl2 and BclxL protein expression ( Figure 5(A)). Compound 7g was also found to inhibit Bcl2 and BclxL expression in SW-620 cells ( Figure 5(B)). These findings thus indicate that compound 7c and 7g inhibited cell viability by inhibiting Bcl2 and BclxL resulting in the apoptosis.
